item.title: KSR Footwear Reports Widening Losses in Q2, Shifts Registered Office
item.description: Top News KSR Footwear Reports Widening Losses in Q2, Shifts Registered Office 1 hour ago KSR Footwear Limited reported a significant increase in losses for Q2, with net loss rising to Rs 91.51 from Rs 5.33 in the previous year, a 1617% increase. Revenue declined by 16.30% to Rs 424.30. The company's board approved relocating its registered office from Kolkata to the Panpur factory in West Bengal, effective December 10. This move may be part of a strategy to streamline operations and reduce costs amidst financial challenges.

item.title: Desco Infratech Secures Rs. 9.38 Crore Order from Gujarat Gas Limited
item.description: Desco Infratech Secures Rs. 9.38 Crore Order from Gujarat Gas Limited 42 minutes ago Desco Infratech Limited has received a new purchase order worth Rs. 9.38 crore from Gujarat Gas Limited for PNG installations and operations & maintenance activities in Surat and Valsad areas. The order includes PNG installations in Cluster 3C-Utran, Mota Varachha City Area, and Velenja Surrounding Area of Surat GA, as well as PE-PNG Operations & Maintenance Activity at Sarigam Surrounding area Cluster in Valsad GA. This order strengthens Desco Infratech's position in the city gas distribution segment and maintains their order book above Rs. 370 crores.

item.title: Markets at Noon: Nifty and Sensex Slip Marginally on December 10
item.description: Markets at Noon: Nifty and Sensex Slip Marginally on December 10 2 hours ago Indian stock markets show a slight downward trend at midday with Nifty 50 at 25,832.00 (-0.03%) and Sensex at 84,628.37 (-0.04%). Key stocks buzzing include InterGlobe Aviation facing DGCA notice, Biocon acquiring stake in Biocon Biologics, Infosys expanding to Vietnam, ICICI Bank increasing stake in ICICI AMC, and Pine Labs reporting strong quarterly results. The market sentiment remains cautious with investors closely watching developments across various sectors.

item.title: Meesho's Strong Market Debut: Shares List at 45% Premium on BSE
item.description: Meesho's Strong Market Debut: Shares List at 45% Premium on BSE 4 hours ago Meesho made a strong debut on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with its shares listing at ₹161.20, a 45% premium over the issue price of ₹111.00. The listing price represents a gain of ₹50.20 per share for IPO investors. This robust performance indicates positive investor sentiment towards Meesho's business model and the growing e-commerce sector in India.
